result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul E Wise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
No contact with The Nathan Nichols Company or store. No contact with Jodi Jacobs.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Must write a minimum 100 word apology letter to the victims estate. This to be done within the first 30 days of probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. Court dismisses Ct. 3 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and must pay a DNA surcharge. Defendant ready to proceed to sentence without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.  Probation review hearing set for 2/29/16 at 3:00 pm.
State's Discovery Demand

No contact direct or indirect with J.J. or anyone associated with the N.N. estate. No contact with the business located at 8068 STH 57. Not to leave Door, Kewaunee or Brown counties without prior court approval.
State requests no contact with J.J., anyone associated with N.N. estate or the business.  Court grants request.
Assuming the Information mirrors the criminal complaint, Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains as is.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file the Information later today.

Defendant Paul E Wise in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Paul E Wise in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/14/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 7/28/15)
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center. Not to leave Door, Kewaunee or Brown Counties without prior court approval.

Defendant Paul E Wise appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers who appears in person.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
